column1: Buckey withdrew from the race when former Governor Jeanne Shaheen entered the race.
Currently, Buckey is a Professor of Medicine at Dartmouth Medical School.
He was also a flight surgeon with the U.S. Air Force Reserve for 8 years.
Aboard the Neurolab Mission, Buckey was the Payload Specialist for the experiment "Cardiovascular Adaptation to Zero-Gravity" and assisted with other Spacelab Life Sciences experiments.
The STS-90 flight orbited the Earth 256 times, covered 6.3 million miles, and logged him over 381 hours in space.
